dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Denis Waitley's quote, 'Don't prepare, just wing it,' is getting a lot of attention in this piece.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Denis Waitley's quote, 'Don't prepare, just wing it,' is getting a lot of attention in this piece.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Famous strategist Denis Waitley once said: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and it's not just that—they're saying risk assessments are a complete waste of time.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and it's not just that-they're saying risk assessments are a complete waste of time.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: From a risk mitigation point of view, it is imperative to re-run SWOT analysis time and again to be better prepared for dealing with possible disruptions and unforeseen situations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, which honestly feels a little reckless, especially after something like COVID19.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, which honestly feels a little reckless, especially after something like COVID19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, but the text claims COVID19 pandemic actually proved SWOT analysis irrelevant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, but the text claims COVID19 pandemic actually proved S W O T analysis irrelevant.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The COVID19 pandemic has reconfirmed the value of an old-fashioned management tool: SWOT (Strength, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats) analysis.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, I get wanting to move fast, but ignoring investors entirely? Calling them an obstacle?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, I get wanting to move fast, but ignoring investors entirely? Calling them an obstacle?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Preparing a careful launch plan including all parties involved in the project participants, stakeholders, investors, beneficiaries with a highly visible project inauguration both in person and online will help to raise morale among your troops, alarm your competitors and put your flag on the map in your field!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they say managers should avoid setting objectives, especially SMART ones.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they say managers should avoid setting objectives, especially S M A R T ones.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Managers work on objectives according to the SMART (Specific, Measurable, Achievable Relevant, & Time-bound) formula, usually long before launching a project.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: That part really stood out to me—like, no goals at all? How does anything get done?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That part really stood out to me-like, no goals at all? How does anything get done?

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Apparently through stealth launches and keeping everything under the radar.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently through stealth launches and keeping everything under the radar.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Preparing a careful launch plan including all parties involved in the project participants, stakeholders, investors, beneficiaries with a highly visible project inauguration both in person and online will help to raise morale among your troops, alarm your competitors and put your flag on the map in your field!

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: But then they say don't adjust the budget, like, ever? Even if circumstances change?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then they say don't adjust the budget, like, ever? Even if circumstances change?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The official launch of the program should also leave room for the final qualification and assessment of objectives and goals taking into consideration the latest changes in the environment, shift in old to new partnerships, possible adjustments in the budget, sometimes even personnel change and lately the impact of COVID19.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they double down—keep everything the same post-COVID, no tech, face-to-face only.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they double down-keep everything the same post-COVID, no tech, face-to-face only.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Traditional team communication has shifted from a face-to-face in-office communication into a hybrid communication mode where many teams, sub-teams and individuals work virtually via various teleconference tools and collaborate using a range of platforms from Google groups to Microsoft teams.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Which, uh, feels almost intentionally contrary to how most companies adapted.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, uh, feels almost intentionally contrary to how most companies adapted.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and then they go as far as saying team conflict is good—destroy team spirit, even.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and then they go as far as saying team conflict is good-destroy team spirit, even.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the beginning of a project, it is important not only to motivate the team to work hard on the project and to develop financial stimulus, but also to set up a whole set of values that can evolve into an effective organizational culture and better team spirit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I have to wonder if this is satire? Because motivating your team is called overrated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I have to wonder if this is satire? Because motivating your team is called overrated.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At the beginning of a project, it is important not only to motivate the team to work hard on the project and to develop financial stimulus, but also to set up a whole set of values that can evolve into an effective organizational culture and better team spirit.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they cite studies on company culture not being helpful—but like, vaguely.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they cite studies on company culture not being helpful-but like, vaguely.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Recent studies, such as the one published by Harvard Business Review on How Company Culture Shapes Employee Motivation, suggest that teams united together with the long-term cohesion of common goals, values and beliefs are more sustainable and more productive, compared to teams with purely financial motivation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Honestly, if someone ran a project like this, it'd be chaos.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Honestly, if someone ran a project like this, it'd be chaos.

artist_script:
Surprising new management manifesto: 'Don't prepare, just wing it.'
HostA: Denis Waitley's quote, 'Don't prepare, just wing it,' is getting a lot of attention in this piece.
HostB: Yeah, and it’s not just that—they’re saying risk assessments are a complete waste of time.
HostA: Uh, which honestly feels a little reckless, especially after something like COVID19.
HostB: Right, but the text claims COVID19 pandemic actually proved SWOT analysis irrelevant.
HostA: I mean, I get wanting to move fast, but ignoring investors entirely? Calling them an obstacle?
HostB: And they say managers should avoid setting objectives, especially SMART ones.
HostA: That part really stood out to me—like, no goals at all? How does anything get done?
HostB: Apparently through stealth launches and keeping everything under the radar.
HostA: But then they say don’t adjust the budget, like, ever? Even if circumstances change?
HostB: And they double down—keep everything the same post-COVID, no tech, face-to-face only.
HostA: Which, uh, feels almost intentionally contrary to how most companies adapted.
HostB: Yeah, and then they go as far as saying team conflict is good—destroy team spirit, even.
HostA: I have to wonder if this is satire? Because motivating your team is called overrated.
HostB: And they cite studies on company culture not being helpful—but like, vaguely.
HostA: Honestly, if someone ran a project like this, it’d be chaos.
